body:
# Currently failing tests:

## From Basic Tests Linux
c++_linux_dbg.bins/dbg/json_run_localhost --scenarios_json '{"scenarios": [{"name": "cpp_protobuf_async_client_sync_server_streaming_qps_unconstrained_secure", "warmup_seconds": 0, "benchmark_seconds": 1, "num_servers": 1, "server_config": {"async_server_threads": 0, "security_params": {"use_test_ca": true, "server_host_override": "foo.test.google.fr"}, "server_type": "SYNC_SERVER"}, "num_clients": 0, "client_config": {"client_type": "ASYNC_CLIENT", "security_params": {"use_test_ca": true, "server_host_override": "foo.test.google.fr"}, "payload_config": {"simple_params": {"resp_size": 0, "req_size": 0}}, "client_channels": 64, "async_client_threads": 0, "outstanding_rpcs_per_channel": 100, "rpc_type": "STREAMING", "load_params": {"closed_loop": {}}, "histogram_params": {"max_possible": 60000000000.0, "resolution": 0.01}}}]}' GRPC_POLL_STRATEGY=poll-cv

**My opinion:** This is a pre-existing flake. It is not possible to have been affected by this PR since these #defines are not used in the code at all.

Also we are not looking at that project for flakes right?

On Thu, Jan 19, 2017, 4:24 PM Vijay Pai <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> Currently failing tests: From Bazel Build&Test
>
> //test/core/bad_ssl:bad_ssl_alpn_server FAILED in 0.3s
>
> /root/.cache/bazel/_bazel_root/d2dc70c3d9da3fab488ba0dcbbd35051/execroot/grpc/bazel-out/local-fastbuild/testlogs/test/core/bad_ssl/bad_ssl_alpn_server/test.log
> //test/core/bad_ssl:bad_ssl_cert_server FAILED in 0.3s
>
> /root/.cache/bazel/_bazel_root/d2dc70c3d9da3fab488ba0dcbbd35051/execroot/grpc/bazel-out/local-fastbuild/testlogs/test/core/bad_ssl/bad_ssl_cert_server/test.log
> //test/core/end2end:h2_fd_test@ping FAILED in 0.1s
>
> /root/.cache/bazel/_bazel_root/d2dc70c3d9da3fab488ba0dcbbd35051/execroot/grpc/bazel-out/local-fastbuild/testlogs/test/core/end2end/h2_fd_test@ping
> /test.log
> //test/core/end2end:h2_proxy_test@compressed_payload FAILED in 0.1s
>
> /root/.cache/bazel/_bazel_root/d2dc70c3d9da3fab488ba0dcbbd35051/execroot/grpc/bazel-out/local-fastbuild/testlogs/test/core/end2end/h2_proxy_test@compressed_payload
> /test.log
> //test/core/end2end:h2_sockpair_1byte_test@ping FAILED in 0.1s
>
> /root/.cache/bazel/_bazel_root/d2dc70c3d9da3fab488ba0dcbbd35051/execroot/grpc/bazel-out/local-fastbuild/testlogs/test/core/end2end/h2_sockpair_1byte_test@ping
> /test.log
> //test/core/end2end:h2_sockpair_test@ping FAILED in 0.1s
>
> /root/.cache/bazel/_bazel_root/d2dc70c3d9da3fab488ba0dcbbd35051/execroot/grpc/bazel-out/local-fastbuild/testlogs/test/core/end2end/h2_sockpair_test@ping
> /test.log
> //test/core/end2end:h2_ssl_proxy_test@compressed_payload FAILED in 0.1s
>
> /root/.cache/bazel/_bazel_root/d2dc70c3d9da3fab488ba0dcbbd35051/execroot/grpc/bazel-out/local-fastbuild/testlogs/test/core/end2end/h2_ssl_proxy_test@compressed_payload
> /test.log
> //test/core/end2end:h2_ssl_proxy_test@connectivity FAILED in 0.2s
>
> /root/.cache/bazel/_bazel_root/d2dc70c3d9da3fab488ba0dcbbd35051/execroot/grpc/bazel-out/local-fastbuild/testlogs/test/core/end2end/h2_ssl_proxy_test@connectivity
> /test.log
>
> Executed 5037 out of 5037 tests: 5029 tests pass and 8 fail locally.
> *My opinion:* these cannot have been affected by this PR because this PR
> is in include/grpc++ and these failures are in test/core
> From Basic Tests Linux
>
> c++_linux_dbg.bins/dbg/json_run_localhost --scenarios_json '{"scenarios":
> [{"name":
> "cpp_protobuf_async_client_sync_server_streaming_qps_unconstrained_secure",
> "warmup_seconds": 0, "benchmark_seconds": 1, "num_servers": 1,
> "server_config": {"async_server_threads": 0, "security_params":
> {"use_test_ca": true, "server_host_override": "foo.test.google.fr"},
> "server_type": "SYNC_SERVER"}, "num_clients": 0, "client_config":
> {"client_type": "ASYNC_CLIENT", "security_params": {"use_test_ca": true,
> "server_host_override": "foo.test.google.fr"}, "payload_config":
> {"simple_params": {"resp_size": 0, "req_size": 0}}, "client_channels": 64,
> "async_client_threads": 0, "outstanding_rpcs_per_channel": 100, "rpc_type":
> "STREAMING", "load_params": {"closed_loop": {}}, "histogram_params":
> {"max_possible": 60000000000.0, "resolution": 0.01}}}]}'
> GRPC_POLL_STRATEGY=poll-cv
>
> *My opinion:* This is a pre-existing flake. It is not possible to have
> been affected by this PR since these #defines are not used in the code at
> all.
>
> —
> You are receiving this because you commented.

I have removed references to Bazel Full Build & Test from the comment documenting failures.
